home.heroSubtitle: Technological infrastructure designed for the structured organization of digital evidence with verifiable chain of custody, documented technical integrity, and support for potential notarial formalization upon request by the holder.
home.introTitle: How to Preserve Digital Evidence with Legal Reliability
home.introP1: Digital evidentiary preservation consists of the structured and chronological organization of digital assets with potential legal relevance, ensuring that their integrity may later be verified by a competent authority.
home.introP2: The process preferably takes place at the pre-litigation stage, organizing records before the initiation of judicial, administrative, or arbitral proceedings, thereby enhancing documentary predictability and reducing disputes regarding integrity.
home.introP3: The admissibility of preserved evidence remains subject to judicial assessment, as the infrastructure is limited to technical preservation and does not perform legal evaluation of the content.
home.pillar1Desc: Structured chronological recording of events related to the digital asset, enabling technical reconstruction of its documentary history.
home.pillar2Desc: Technical identification and registration mechanisms allowing future verification of integrity without exposure of the preserved content.
home.pillar3Desc: Possibility of notarial deed issuance based on previously preserved assets, upon request by the holder.

preservation.title: Digital Evidentiary Preservation
preservation.p1: Preserving digital evidence requires technical mechanisms capable of chronologically recording events related to the asset, ensuring traceability and verifiable integrity over time.
preservation.p2: The digital chain of custody documents operations such as deposit, technical identifier generation, timestamp registration, and holder access, allowing structured historical reconstruction.
preservation.p3: Technical organization of evidence contributes to documentary clarity in judicial, administrative, or arbitral proceedings, while respecting the exclusive competence of the deciding authority.

legalBasis.title: Legal Framework
legalBasis.p1: Brazilian procedural law recognizes electronic documentary evidence provided that its integrity and authenticity can be demonstrated through technically reliable means.
legalBasis.p2: Structured digital records may serve as supporting elements in evidentiary assessment, subject to applicable legal requirements in each specific case.
legalBasis.p3: Notarial formalization, when requested by the holder, may reinforce the chronological documentation of previously preserved evidence.

security.title: Security and Technical Architecture
security.p1: Deposited digital assets are protected through encryption mechanisms and authentication linked to the holder’s digital certificate, restricting access exclusively to the depositor.
security.p2: The preserved content is not accessible to third parties and is stored in a structured environment prioritizing confidentiality, integrity, and technical traceability.
security.p3: Complementary verification records may be used as an additional integrity validation mechanism without exposing the preserved content.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.step1Desc: The process begins with holder identification, which may include notarial validation to reinforce legal reliability.
howItWorks.step2Desc: After authentication, the digital asset is deposited and submitted to generation of a verifiable technical identifier.
howItWorks.step3Desc: Events related to the asset are recorded chronologically within a structured preservation registry.
howItWorks.step4Desc: Subsequent access remains restricted to the holder through digital certificate authentication.

government.content: Public institutions generate digital records that may be used in audits, administrative investigations, and formal proceedings. Prior technical organization contributes to documentary governance and institutional predictability.

companies.content: Companies may structure digital evidence prior to litigation or internal investigations, contributing to compliance frameworks and legal risk mitigation.

individuals.content: Individuals may preserve digital documents with potential future legal relevance, organizing evidence in advance of possible disputes.

terms.title: Custody Terms
terms.p1: These terms establish the conditions governing the use of the digital evidentiary preservation infrastructure.
terms.p2: The depositor bears full responsibility for the submitted content.
terms.p3: The platform is limited to technical preservation and does not provide legal assessment of the content.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.p1: This policy describes the processing of personal data necessary for authentication and service provision.
privacy.p2: Data is protected through appropriate technical security mechanisms.
privacy.p3: The holder may exercise rights provided under applicable data protection legislation.
